title: C120 ‚Äì Browser Hygiene & Setup
description: Master browser security for Web3 trading. Learn to segment browsers, manage extensions safely, control permissions, and harden your setup against drainers and scams.

modules.title: Browser Segmentation
modules.description: Why you should separate real-life and degen activity across different browsers or profiles. Use Brave for trading, Chrome for personal accounts, etc.

lessons.title: Why Browser Segmentation Matters
lessons.content:
**The Problem with Single Browser Usage:**

**Security Risks:**
‚Ä¢ **Cross-Contamination**: Malicious sites can access data from other tabs
‚Ä¢ **Session Hijacking**: One compromised session affects everything
‚Ä¢ **Extension Vulnerabilities**: Risky extensions can access all your data
‚Ä¢ **Tracking**: Sites can track you across different activities
‚Ä¢ **Data Leakage**: Personal info mixed with trading activities

**Real-World Scenarios:**
‚Ä¢ **Drainer Attack**: Malicious site drains your wallet
‚Ä¢ **Phishing Site**: Fake site steals your credentials
‚Ä¢ **Malicious Extension**: Extension steals your data
‚Ä¢ **Session Theft**: Someone gains access to your accounts
‚Ä¢ **Cross-Site Scripting**: Malicious code runs in your browser

**Benefits of Browser Segmentation:**
‚Ä¢ **Isolation**: Problems in one browser don't affect others
‚Ä¢ **Privacy**: Keep personal and trading activities separate
‚Ä¢ **Security**: Reduce attack surface
‚Ä¢ **Organization**: Easier to manage different activities
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: If one browser is compromised, others are safe

**Recommended Browser Setup:**
‚Ä¢ **Brave**: For Web3 trading and DeFi activities
‚Ä¢ **Chrome**: For personal accounts and regular browsing
‚Ä¢ **Firefox**: For sensitive activities (banking, etc.)
‚Ä¢ **Edge**: For work-related activities
‚Ä¢ **Safari**: For Apple ecosystem activities

**Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ Use different email addresses for each browser
‚Ä¢ Don't sync bookmarks between browsers
‚Ä¢ Use different passwords for each browser
‚Ä¢ Clear cookies regularly
‚Ä¢ Use incognito/private mode for sensitive activities

lessons.title: Setting Up Browser Profiles
lessons.content:
**How to Create Browser Profiles:**

**Chrome Profile Setup:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Open Chrome and click your profile icon
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Click "Add" to create a new profile
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Name it (e.g., "Trading", "Personal", "Work")
‚Ä¢ **Step 4**: Choose a color and icon
‚Ä¢ **Step 5**: Sign in with different Google accounts

**Firefox Profile Setup:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Type `about:profiles` in address bar
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Click "Create a New Profile"
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Name your profile
‚Ä¢ **Step 4**: Choose profile location
‚Ä¢ **Step 5**: Set as default if desired

**Brave Profile Setup:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Click the profile icon in top right
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Click "Add New Profile"
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Name your profile
‚Ä¢ **Step 4**: Choose sync settings
‚Ä¢ **Step 5**: Customize settings for each profile

**Profile Organization Strategy:**

**Trading Profile:**
‚Ä¢ **Browser**: Brave or Chrome
‚Ä¢ **Extensions**: Wallet extensions, trading tools
‚Ä¢ **Bookmarks**: Trading sites, DEXs, charts
‚Ä¢ **Settings**: Enhanced privacy, ad blocking
‚Ä¢ **Accounts**: Trading-specific accounts only

**Personal Profile:**
‚Ä¢ **Browser**: Chrome or Firefox
‚Ä¢ **Extensions**: Minimal, trusted only
‚Ä¢ **Bookmarks**: Personal sites, social media
‚Ä¢ **Settings**: Standard privacy settings
‚Ä¢ **Accounts**: Personal accounts only

**Work Profile:**
‚Ä¢ **Browser**: Edge or Chrome
‚Ä¢ **Extensions**: Work-related tools only
‚Ä¢ **Bookmarks**: Work sites, productivity tools
‚Ä¢ **Settings**: Company security policies
‚Ä¢ **Accounts**: Work accounts only

**Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ Use different passwords for each profile
‚Ä¢ Don't share bookmarks between profiles
‚Ä¢ Clear data regularly
‚Ä¢ Use different email addresses
‚Ä¢ Keep trading profile isolated

modules.title: Trusted vs Risky Extensions
modules.description: Learn which browser extensions are safe (wallets, blockers) and which are data mines or security risks.

lessons.title: Safe Browser Extensions
lessons.content:
**Trusted Extension Categories:**

**Wallet Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **MetaMask**: Most trusted Ethereum wallet
‚Ä¢ **Phantom**: Popular Solana wallet
‚Ä¢ **Brave Wallet**: Built into Brave browser
‚Ä¢ **Coinbase Wallet**: Official Coinbase extension
‚Ä¢ **Trust Wallet**: Binance's wallet extension

**Privacy & Security:**
‚Ä¢ **uBlock Origin**: Ad and tracker blocker
‚Ä¢ **Privacy Badger**: Automatic tracker blocking
‚Ä¢ **HTTPS Everywhere**: Forces secure connections
‚Ä¢ **NoScript**: Blocks JavaScript execution
‚Ä¢ **Cookie AutoDelete**: Automatically deletes cookies

**Trading Tools:**
‚Ä¢ **TradingView**: Chart analysis tools
‚Ä¢ **CoinGecko**: Price tracking
‚Ä¢ **DeBank**: DeFi portfolio tracker
‚Ä¢ **DEXScreener**: DEX data and charts
‚Ä¢ **Coinhall**: Solana trading data

**Productivity:**
‚Ä¢ **LastPass**: Password manager
‚Ä¢ **1Password**: Secure password management
‚Ä¢ **Bitwarden**: Open-source password manager
‚Ä¢ **Grammarly**: Writing assistant
‚Ä¢ **Notion Web Clipper**: Save web content

**How to Verify Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **Check Reviews**: Look for high ratings and many reviews
‚Ä¢ **Developer Info**: Research the developer/company
‚Ä¢ **Permissions**: Review what permissions it requests
‚Ä¢ **Update Frequency**: Regular updates are good
‚Ä¢ **Open Source**: Open source extensions are often safer

**Red Flags to Watch For:**
‚Ä¢ **Too Many Permissions**: Requests unnecessary access
‚Ä¢ **No Reviews**: New or unpopular extensions
‚Ä¢ **Suspicious Developer**: Unknown or sketchy developer
‚Ä¢ **Aggressive Marketing**: Spammy or pushy advertising
‚Ä¢ **Copycat Names**: Imitates popular extensions

lessons.title: Dangerous Extensions to Avoid
lessons.content:
**Risky Extension Categories:**

**Data Mining Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **Free VPNs**: Often sell your data
‚Ä¢ **Productivity Tools**: May track your browsing
‚Ä¢ **Shopping Extensions**: Track your purchases
‚Ä¢ **Social Media Tools**: Access your social accounts
‚Ä¢ **Gaming Extensions**: May contain malware

**Malicious Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **Fake Wallets**: Imitate real wallet extensions
‚Ä¢ **Phishing Tools**: Designed to steal credentials
‚Ä¢ **Cryptocurrency Miners**: Use your computer for mining
‚Ä¢ **Ad Injectors**: Insert unwanted ads
‚Ä¢ **Browser Hijackers**: Change your homepage/search

**Common Attack Vectors:**
‚Ä¢ **Fake MetaMask**: Malicious copy of MetaMask
‚Ä¢ **Fake Phantom**: Malicious copy of Phantom
‚Ä¢ **Fake Trading Tools**: Imitate legitimate trading tools
‚Ä¢ **Fake Password Managers**: Steal your passwords
‚Ä¢ **Fake Ad Blockers**: Actually show more ads

**How to Spot Fake Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **Check URL**: Verify it's from official store
‚Ä¢ **Developer Name**: Should match official company
‚Ä¢ **Install Count**: Popular extensions have many installs
‚Ä¢ **Reviews**: Look for authentic reviews
‚Ä¢ **Permissions**: Should be minimal and relevant

**Protection Strategies:**
‚Ä¢ **Only Install from Official Stores**: Chrome Web Store, Firefox Add-ons
‚Ä¢ **Verify Developer**: Research the developer/company
‚Ä¢ **Read Permissions**: Understand what it can access
‚Ä¢ **Start Small**: Install one extension at a time
‚Ä¢ **Monitor Behavior**: Watch for unusual activity

**Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ **Whitelist Approach**: Only install essential extensions
‚Ä¢ **Regular Audits**: Review installed extensions monthly
‚Ä¢ **Remove Unused**: Delete extensions you don't use
‚Ä¢ **Update Regularly**: Keep extensions updated
‚Ä¢ **Backup Settings**: Export extension settings

modules.title: Permission Control
modules.description: How to manually lock down your browser permissions: clipboard, popups, autofill, microphone, and more.

lessons.title: Understanding Browser Permissions
lessons.content:
**What are Browser Permissions?**
Browser permissions control what websites and extensions can access on your device.

**Common Permissions:**

**Location:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Allows sites to know your location
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Privacy invasion, tracking
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block for most sites
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for mapping/navigation sites

**Camera:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Access to your webcam
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Unauthorized video recording
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for video calls

**Microphone:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Access to your microphone
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Audio recording without consent
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for voice calls

**Notifications:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Send push notifications
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Spam, unwanted alerts
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block for most sites
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for important services

**Clipboard:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Read/write to clipboard
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Steal copied data
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted tools

**Autofill:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Auto-fill forms with saved data
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Data theft, form manipulation
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Disable for sensitive sites
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted sites

**Popups:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Open new windows/tabs
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Malicious popups, scams
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Block by default
‚Ä¢ **When to allow**: Only for trusted sites

**JavaScript:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Run code on websites
‚Ä¢ **Risk**: Malicious scripts, tracking
‚Ä¢ **Recommendation**: Allow but use blockers
‚Ä¢ **When to block**: Suspicious sites only

lessons.title: Locking Down Your Browser
lessons.content:
**How to Secure Browser Permissions:**

**Chrome Security Settings:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Privacy and Security
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Click "Site Settings"
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Configure each permission:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block
  - **JavaScript**: Allow (use extensions to block)

**Firefox Security Settings:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Privacy & Security
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Set "Enhanced Tracking Protection" to Strict
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Configure permissions:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block

**Brave Security Settings:**
‚Ä¢ **Step 1**: Go to Settings > Shields
‚Ä¢ **Step 2**: Set Shields to "Aggressive"
‚Ä¢ **Step 3**: Configure site settings:
  - **Location**: Block
  - **Camera**: Block
  - **Microphone**: Block
  - **Notifications**: Block
  - **Popups**: Block

**Advanced Security Measures:**

**Content Security Policy:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Controls what resources can load
‚Ä¢ **Implementation**: Use browser extensions
‚Ä¢ **Benefits**: Prevents XSS attacks
‚Ä¢ **Configuration**: Block inline scripts

**HTTP Strict Transport Security:**
‚Ä¢ **What it does**: Forces HTTPS connections
‚Ä¢ **Implementation**: Built into modern browsers
‚Ä¢ **Benefits**: Prevents man-in-the-middle attacks
‚Ä¢ **Configuration**: Enable in browser settings

**Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ **Whitelist Approach**: Block everything, allow only what you need
‚Ä¢ **Regular Audits**: Check permissions monthly
‚Ä¢ **Use Extensions**: Security extensions can help
‚Ä¢ **Test Settings**: Make sure sites still work
‚Ä¢ **Backup Settings**: Export your security configuration

modules.title: Hardening for Web3
modules.description: How to prepare your browser before interacting with mints, airdrops, or DApps. Avoid drainers before they drain you.

lessons.title: Web3 Security Threats
lessons.content:
**Common Web3 Security Threats:**

**Drainer Attacks:**
‚Ä¢ **What it is**: Malicious sites that drain your wallet
‚Ä¢ **How it works**: Tricks you into signing malicious transactions
‚Ä¢ **Signs**: Unrealistic promises, urgent pressure
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: Never sign transactions from unknown sites
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: Use hardware wallets, separate hot wallets

**Phishing Sites:**
‚Ä¢ **What it is**: Fake sites that look like real ones
‚Ä¢ **How it works**: Steals your private keys or seed phrases
‚Ä¢ **Signs**: Slightly different URLs, poor design
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: Always verify URLs, use bookmarks
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: Never enter seed phrases on websites

**Malicious DApps:**
‚Ä¢ **What it is**: Decentralized apps with hidden malicious code
‚Ä¢ **How it works**: Executes unwanted transactions
‚Ä¢ **Signs**: Unrealistic returns, pressure to act fast
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: Research DApps before using
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: Use separate wallets for testing

**Fake Airdrops:**
‚Ä¢ **What it is**: Fake token distributions
‚Ä¢ **How it works**: Claims to give free tokens but steals your data
‚Ä¢ **Signs**: Too good to be true, urgent deadlines
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: Verify airdrops through official channels
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: Never connect wallets to unknown sites

**Malicious Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **What it is**: Browser extensions that steal crypto
‚Ä¢ **How it works**: Intercepts wallet connections
‚Ä¢ **Signs**: Fake wallet extensions, suspicious permissions
‚Ä¢ **Protection**: Only install from official sources
‚Ä¢ **Recovery**: Remove suspicious extensions immediately

**Prevention Strategies:**
‚Ä¢ **Use Hardware Wallets**: Keep most funds offline
‚Ä¢ **Separate Wallets**: Use different wallets for different purposes
‚Ä¢ **Research Everything**: Verify before interacting
‚Ä¢ **Slow Down**: Don't rush into opportunities
‚Ä¢ **Stay Updated**: Keep software updated

lessons.title: Preparing Your Browser for Web3
lessons.content:
**Web3 Browser Setup Checklist:**

**Essential Extensions:**
‚Ä¢ **MetaMask**: For Ethereum interactions
‚Ä¢ **Phantom**: For Solana interactions
‚Ä¢ **uBlock Origin**: Block malicious ads and trackers
‚Ä¢ **Privacy Badger**: Additional privacy protection
‚Ä¢ **NoScript**: Block malicious scripts

**Browser Settings:**
‚Ä¢ **Disable JavaScript**: For unknown sites
‚Ä¢ **Block Popups**: Prevent malicious popups
‚Ä¢ **Disable Autofill**: Prevent data theft
‚Ä¢ **Clear Cookies**: Regularly clear browsing data
‚Ä¢ **Use Incognito**: For sensitive transactions

**Wallet Security:**
‚Ä¢ **Hardware Wallet**: Use for large amounts
‚Ä¢ **Hot Wallet**: Use for small amounts only
‚Ä¢ **Separate Wallets**: Different wallets for different purposes
‚Ä¢ **Backup Seeds**: Store securely offline
‚Ä¢ **Test Transactions**: Small amounts first

**Site Verification:**
‚Ä¢ **Check URLs**: Verify you're on the right site
‚Ä¢ **Use Bookmarks**: Bookmark trusted sites
‚Ä¢ **Research Projects**: Verify before investing
‚Ä¢ **Check Social Media**: Official announcements only
‚Ä¢ **Avoid FOMO**: Don't rush into opportunities

**Transaction Safety:**
‚Ä¢ **Review Transactions**: Always check before signing
‚Ä¢ **Gas Limits**: Set appropriate gas limits
‚Ä¢ **Slippage**: Use reasonable slippage settings
‚Ä¢ **Test Transactions**: Small amounts first
‚Ä¢ **Monitor Activity**: Check wallet activity regularly

**Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ **Start Small**: Test with small amounts
‚Ä¢ **Stay Informed**: Follow security news
‚Ä¢ **Use Multiple Browsers**: Separate activities
‚Ä¢ **Regular Audits**: Check security monthly
‚Ä¢ **Backup Everything**: Keep backups secure

modules.title: Assignment
modules.description: Audit your browser setup. Post a screenshot or summary of your trading browser profile and what you changed.

lessons.title: Browser Security Audit Assignment
lessons.content:
**üéØ Assignment: Audit Your Browser Security**

**Objective:**
Apply your browser hygiene knowledge by auditing and securing your trading browser setup.

**Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Audit your current browser setup
‚Ä¢ Implement security improvements
‚Ä¢ Document your changes
‚Ä¢ Share your findings with the community
‚Ä¢ Test your security measures

**Step-by-Step Instructions:**

**1. Current State Assessment**
‚Ä¢ **List Installed Extensions**: Write down all extensions
‚Ä¢ **Check Permissions**: Review site permissions
‚Ä¢ **Identify Risks**: Note any security concerns
‚Ä¢ **Document Settings**: Screenshot current settings
‚Ä¢ **Note Issues**: Any problems or suspicious activity

**2. Browser Segmentation Setup**
‚Ä¢ **Create Trading Profile**: Set up dedicated trading browser
‚Ä¢ **Choose Browser**: Brave, Chrome, or Firefox
‚Ä¢ **Name Profile**: "Trading" or "Web3"
‚Ä¢ **Customize Settings**: Apply security settings
‚Ä¢ **Test Profile**: Make sure it works properly

**3. Extension Audit**
‚Ä¢ **Review Extensions**: Check each installed extension
‚Ä¢ **Remove Risky Ones**: Delete suspicious extensions
‚Ä¢ **Install Safe Ones**: Add recommended security extensions
‚Ä¢ **Configure Settings**: Set up extension preferences
‚Ä¢ **Test Functionality**: Ensure everything works

**4. Permission Lockdown**
‚Ä¢ **Location**: Block for all sites
‚Ä¢ **Camera**: Block for all sites
‚Ä¢ **Microphone**: Block for all sites
‚Ä¢ **Notifications**: Block for most sites
‚Ä¢ **Popups**: Block for all sites
‚Ä¢ **JavaScript**: Allow but use blockers

**5. Web3 Security Setup**
‚Ä¢ **Install Wallet Extensions**: MetaMask, Phantom
‚Ä¢ **Configure Security**: Set up wallet security
‚Ä¢ **Test Connections**: Verify wallet connections
‚Ä¢ **Bookmark Sites**: Save trusted sites
‚Ä¢ **Practice Safety**: Test with small amounts

**6. Documentation**
‚Ä¢ **Take Screenshots**: Before and after changes
‚Ä¢ **List Changes**: Document all modifications
‚Ä¢ **Explain Reasoning**: Why you made each change
‚Ä¢ **Note Results**: Any issues or improvements
‚Ä¢ **Plan Maintenance**: How to keep it secure

**7. Community Sharing**
‚Ä¢ **Post Screenshots**: Share your setup (safely)
‚Ä¢ **List Extensions**: What you installed/removed
‚Ä¢ **Share Tips**: What worked for you
‚Ä¢ **Ask Questions**: Get feedback from others
‚Ä¢ **Help Others**: Respond to other students

**Success Criteria:**
‚úÖ Created dedicated trading browser profile
‚úÖ Removed all risky extensions
‚úÖ Locked down permissions
‚úÖ Installed security extensions
‚úÖ Tested Web3 functionality
‚úÖ Documented all changes
‚úÖ Shared with community

**Bonus Challenges:**
‚Ä¢ Set up hardware wallet integration
‚Ä¢ Configure advanced security settings
‚Ä¢ Test with multiple wallets
‚Ä¢ Create security checklist
‚Ä¢ Help other students with setup

**Safety Reminders:**
‚Ä¢ Never share private keys or seed phrases
‚Ä¢ Use separate wallets for testing
‚Ä¢ Start with small amounts
‚Ä¢ Research everything before interacting
‚Ä¢ Stay updated on security threats
